definition: to fan into a flame/to incite
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
the crime of instigating counterrevolutionary propaganda
pinyin: fan3 ge2 ming4 xuan1 chuan2 shan1 dong4 zui4

definition: incitement to subvert state power (criminal charge used to gag free speech)
pinyin: shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2

definition: crime of conspiring to overthrow the state
pinyin: shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zui4

sentences.english: When Sin claps his broad wings over the battle.
sentences.chinese: 當罪惡煽動巨翼在戰鬥中肆虐。

sentences.english: She faces charges of inciting racial hatred by distributing anti-semitic leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 她因散發反猶傳單而面臨着煽動種族仇恨的指控。

sentences.english: Hitler's just a self-educated street agitator.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒無非是個自學出身的街頭煽動家罷了。

sentences.english: They were licensing, taxation , and seditious libel.
sentences.chinese: 它們是許可證，稅收和煽動性誹謗。

sentences.english: On Sabertron, the Destrons incite an uprising among the prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 塞伯特恩之迪斯坦逆黨煽動囚犯暴動。

sentences.english: They sowed rebellion broadcast in our army.
sentences.chinese: 他們在我們的部隊中煽動叛亂。

sentences.english: Gentlemen, sir, have been charged with giving birth to sedition in America.
sentences.chinese: 先生們，議員被指責在亞美利加進行煽動。

sentences.english: Critics have accused him of rabble-rousing.
sentences.chinese: 評論家譴責他煽動羣衆。

sentences.english: Clearly that it and the man of iron of the soccer go, craque and that they forgive me demagogues .
sentences.chinese: 很明顯他將再一次前進和征服，原諒我的煽動。

sentences.english: He sticked provocative poster on board when nobody was looking.
sentences.chinese: 趁無人注意，他在板上貼了具有煽動性的海報。

sentences.english: While you preach peace, you make it the business of your life to stir up dissension.
sentences.chinese: 你一邊宣傳和平，一邊又幹着煽動紛爭的營生。

sentences.english: At a time of famine, it was an inflammatory statement.
sentences.chinese: “在饑荒時期”，是一種煽動性的說法。

sentences.english: When it provokes avarice, it becomes a sin.
sentences.chinese: 當它煽動了貪婪，它就變成了罪。

sentences.english: The possibility of warmongering, "racking crazy" USA being wiped out? If only.
sentences.chinese: 煽動戰爭的可能，“壓力下瘋狂”的美國精疲力竭了？

sentences.english: Therefore, in the name of religion protection, Dalai Lama instigated serfs to rebel CPC .
sentences.chinese: 達賴就以保教的名義煽動那些農奴反對中共。

sentences.english: The authorities arrested the main agitator of the movement.
sentences.chinese: 當局拘捕了運動的主要煽動者。

definition: Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
